intro: Capparis forsteniana, commonly known as the Forsten's caper, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a shrub characterized by its thorny stems and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by fleshy, red berries. It thrives in coastal and rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
